it.unipr.ce.dsg.deus.core
Class AutomatorParser

java.lang.Object
  it.unipr.ce.dsg.deus.core.AutomatorParser

public class AutomatorParser
extends java.lang.Object

This class is responsible for handling the simulation configuration file according to the DEUS xml schema.

The configuration can be seen as a set of nodes, resources, events, processes and engine parameters. This class handles the configuration of each simulation object and stores them in a set of array data structures.

Each simulation object have a set of base features plus references to other simulation objects: nodes can have a set of resources, events can have a set of referenced events, processes can have references both to nodes and events.

At the end of the configuration file parsing process, this class will initialize an Engine object enabling the simulation execution.

Author:
Matteo Agosti (agosti@ce.unipr.it), Michele Amoretti (michele.amoretti@unipr.it)
See Also:
Engine

Class constructor responsible for configuration file handling and engine initialization.

Parameters:
fileName - the configuration file to open.
Throws:
javax.xml.bind.JAXBException - if the configuration file format is wrong.
java.lang.ClassNotFoundException - if the configuration file contains handlers (fully qualified class names) not existing in the classpath.
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the handler class cannot be instantiated.
java.lang.SecurityException - if the handler class cannot be instantiated.
java.lang.InstantiationException - if the handler class cannot be instantiated.
java.lang.IllegalAccessException - if the handler class cannot be instantiated.
java.lang.reflect.InvocationTargetException - if the handler class cannot be instantiated.
java.lang.NoSuchMethodException - if the handler class cannot be instantiated.
